net.sourceforge.gjtapi.raw
Interface MediaTpi

All Known Subinterfaces:
FullJtapiTpi, TelephonyProvider
public interface MediaTpi
extends BasicJtapiTpi

These are the methods required by TelephonyProviders that support media for JTAPI Creation date: (2000-10-04 13:46:43)

Method Detail

allocateMedia

public boolean allocateMedia(java.lang.String terminal,
                             int type,
                             java.util.Dictionary resourceArgs)
Allocate a media resource for a terminal.

This may be called subsequant times for the same resource on the same terminal in order to replace the resourceArgs dictionary associated with the resource.

One resourceArgs entry that must be handled is the mapping of p_EnableEvents to ev_SignalDetected. This indicates that detected signals should be reported through an event.

Parameters:
terminal - The terminal to attach a media resource to.
type - A constant defining the type of resource to add.
resourceArgs - Optional values and parameters for configuring the resource.
Returns:
true if the resource is allocated

freeMedia

public boolean freeMedia(java.lang.String terminal,
                         int type)
Free a media resource from a terminal
Parameters:
terminal - The terminal to release a media resource from.
type - A constant defining the type of resource to release.
Returns:
true if the resource is freed.

isMediaTerminal

public boolean isMediaTerminal(java.lang.String terminal)
Ask the RawProvider if the named terminal is media-capable. Creation date: (2000-03-07 15:35:02)
Parameters:
terminal - The raw-provider specific unique name for the terminal
Returns:
true if the terminal can be used with media control commands.

play

public void play(java.lang.String terminal,
                 java.lang.String[] streamIds,
                 int offset,
                 javax.telephony.media.RTC[] rtcs,
                 java.util.Dictionary optArgs)
          throws javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException
Start playing a set of audio streams named by the streamIds (may be urls).
Parameters:
terminal - The terminal to play the audio on.
streamIds - The ids for the audi streams to play, usually URLs
int - offset The number of milliseconds into the audio to start
rtcs - A set of runtime control sets that tune th playing.
optArgs - A dictionary of optional arguments and commands for controlling the play.
Throws:
javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException - A wrapper for a PlayerEvent that describes what went wrong.

record

public void record(java.lang.String terminal,
                   java.lang.String streamId,
                   javax.telephony.media.RTC[] rtcs,
                   java.util.Dictionary optArgs)
            throws javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException
Start recording an audio streams named by the streamId (may be urls).
Parameters:
terminal - The terminal to record the audio from.
streamId - The id for the audio streams to create, usually a URL
rtcs - A set of runtime control sets that tune the recording.
optArgs - A dictionary of optional arguments and commands for controlling the play.
Throws:
javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException - A wrapper for a RecorderEvent that describes what went wrong.

retrieveSignals

public RawSigDetectEvent retrieveSignals(java.lang.String terminal,
                                         int num,
                                         javax.telephony.media.Symbol[] patterns,
                                         javax.telephony.media.RTC[] rtcs,
                                         java.util.Dictionary optArgs)
                                  throws javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException
Receive DTMF tones from a terminal
Parameters:
terminal - The terminal the signal receiver is attached to.
num - The number of signals to retrieve
syms - A set of symbols patterns to return
rtcs - A set of runtime control sets that tune the signalling.
optArgs - A dictionary of optional arguments and commands for controlling the play.
Returns:
A GenericSignalDectectorEvent that can be sent getSignalBuffer() to retrieve the signals.
Throws:
javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException - A wrapper for a SignalDetectorEvent that describes what went wrong.

sendSignals

public void sendSignals(java.lang.String terminal,
                        javax.telephony.media.Symbol[] syms,
                        javax.telephony.media.RTC[] rtcs,
                        java.util.Dictionary optArgs)
                 throws javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException
Play DTMF tones on a terminal
Parameters:
terminal - The terminal to record the audio from.
syms - A set of symbols to play
rtcs - A set of runtime control sets that tune the signalling.
optArgs - A dictionary of optional arguments and commands for controlling the play.
Throws:
javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException - A wrapper for a SignalGeneratorEvent that describes what went wrong.

stop

public void stop(java.lang.String terminal)
Stop any media resources attached to a terminal.

The implmentation of this method should be synchronous in the the raw provider is expected to have stopped all media resources before it returns, although this behaviour is not required by the framework. Creation date: (2000-03-09 16:08:12)

Parameters:
terminal - The terminal name.

triggerRTC

public void triggerRTC(java.lang.String terminal,
                       javax.telephony.media.Symbol action)
Send Runtime control actions to media resources bound to a terminal.

At the very least, implementors should handle the Symbols PlayerConstants.rtca_Stop and RecorderConstants.rtca_Stop to stop any play or record calls. Creation date: (2000-03-09 16:09:09)

Parameters:
terminal - The name of the terminal the media resources are bound to.
action - The RTC action symbol to invoke on the media resources.
